abstract: Study in Journal of the American Medical Assn finds nearly two-thirds of women undergoing in vitro fertilization will give birth by sixth attempt, countering prevailing wisdom that one should give up by third or fourth try.
lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of women reported having a child by the sixth cycle, upending the assumption that the chances after three or four failed tries are dismal.

headline.main: With In Vitro Fertilization, Persistence Pays Off, Study Suggests
headline.print_headline: Study on In Vitro Birth Says Persistence Can Pay Off

snippet: Two-thirds of women reported having a child by the sixth cycle, upending the assumption that the chances after three or four failed tries are dismal.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
